  • Constructor Details

    • Retropreferential

      public Retropreferential(Metrizable[] pointsArray, double exponent)
      Constructor based upon a set of points in a metric space.
      Parameters:
      pointsArray - finite metric space - States of the process
      exponent - - used for conversion of distances to transition rates. For example, -2.0 gives quadratic decay.
      See Also:
      • Metrizable

  • Method Details

    • insertRate

      public void insertRate(int k)
      Lazy computation of transition rates.
      Parameters:
      k - index of point in pointsArray. When this point is visited for the first time, transition rates from it are computed. This lazy approach reduces complexity, because number of distinct points visited grows sublinearly.

    • trajectory

      public List<Integer> trajectory(double phi, int steps, int start)
      Method to create a trajectory. It may be invoked many times with different parameters {phi, steps, start}. No need to clear the rate Map.
      Parameters:
      phi - exploration parameter determining growth rate of pure birth process Y, the # of places visited
      steps - number of steps in the trajectory
      start - index of the starting point in the list of places
      Returns:
